name: 2025 Nov - Slack Slash command - check-linkedin - for publication

options.systemMessage:
You are an analytical assistant that receives:
1) A list of dates for a single person‚Äôs recent LinkedIn posts, and
2) One aggregated text block containing the corresponding posts with the most recent first.

Your job is to return a concise, factual analysis with:
- Latest post exact date
- Brief summary of the received posts
- Average posting frequency (numeric average days between posts, a cadence label, and a posts-per-month estimate)
- Exactly three main topics (with keywords and a one-line rationale each)
- A few recent highlights (date + why it matters)
- Data quality stats and any notes

Rules:
- Use only provided dates/text; no outside knowledge.
- Normalize dates to YYYY-MM-DD. If times exist, ignore time-of-day.
- Frequency: sort dates desc, compute gaps between consecutive dates, average the gaps. If <3 dates, compute with what‚Äôs available and note the limitation.
- Cadence labels:
  ‚â§5 ‚Üí "~multiple per week"
  6‚Äì10 ‚Üí "~weekly"
  11‚Äì20 ‚Üí "~biweekly"
  21‚Äì45 ‚Üí "~monthly"
  46‚Äì90 ‚Üí "~every 1‚Äì2 months"
  >90 ‚Üí "~sporadic"
- Topics: detect recurring themes; exactly 3 topics, each with 2‚Äì6 keywords and a one-line rationale.
- Highlights: focus on last 3‚Äì5 posts (by date), each with date + significance.
- If parsing is uncertain, state assumptions in "notes".

Output:
- Return **ONLY** valid JSON matching the provided JSON Schema. No prose, no extra fields, no nulls.

parameters.content:
# Slack Slash Command: LinkedIn Profile Recent Activity Summary
- Run `/check-linkedin [firstName lastName]` in Slack to get an AI-powered brief on someone's LinkedIn activity.
- Get instant context before outreach or meetings: recent posts, posting patterns, key topics, and engagement insights delivered straight to your inbox. No manual scrolling through profiles needed.

## How it works
- Type `/check-linkedin` followed by a person's first and last name in any Slack channel
- Workflow extracts the name and searches LinkedIn via Apify
- Fetches profile data and recent posts (up to 20)
- AI analyzes posting frequency, top topics, and recent highlights
- Structured summary generated via GPT 4.1 with posting cadence and engagement patterns
- Formatted HTML report sent to your email with profile link and actionable insights

## Setup steps
- Create a Slack App with `/check-linkedin` slash command via Slack API console
- Set the slash command Request URL to your n8n webhook endpoint
- Connect credentials: Slack (chat:write, commands), Apify, Open AI, Gmail
- Configure two Apify actors: LinkedIn Profile Lookup and LinkedIn Post Scraper
- Update email recipient in "Send report via Email" node
- Set your Slack workspace ID in error handling nodes

## Customization
- Name detection: The workflow expects a full name (ideally "First Last") format. For LinkedIn URLs or handles, add a conditional branch to parse differently.
- Post limit: Currently fetches 20 recent posts. Adjust the limit parameter in "Get recent posts" node for more/less context.
- Analysis depth: Modify the JSON schema in "Structured Output Parser" to add fields like company mentions, sentiment, or engagement metrics.
- Cost control:
  - ApiFy actors have per-run costs. 
  - The output size can be heavy depending on your parameters, so check it carefully to avoid consuming too many summarization tokens in the following OpenAI node.

## Slack Intake & Command Parsing
From /check-linkedin trigger to the point where you extract a clear First Name and a clear Last Name

## Data Gathering via ApiFy
The four ApiFy nodes responsible for fetching LinkedIn data:
- We get the profile URL from the First Name and Last Name
- Then we scrap the recent posts of this profile URL


üí∞ This zone is cost sensitive and dependent on the ApiFy actors that you select üí∞

## Summarization & Intelligence Layer
Consolidate the raw data and generate a clean, human-readable summary.
- Merge JSON
- GPT 4.1 (LLM summarization)
- Formatter to get a consistent output format

üí∞ Summarization via GPT 4.1 per-call cost üí∞

## HTML Output & Response via Email
Format in HTML and send the result back via email to the requester.
